head.title: World Briefing | Americas: Mexico: If You Can't Beat 'Em . . .

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Americas: Mexico: If You Can't Beat 'Em . . .

abstract.p: Governors of four Mexican states bordering United States consider decriminalizing marijuana; Gov Patricio Martinez of Chihuahua says drug consumption keeps rising in spite of wars waged against it; much of marijuana sold in US is grown in Mexico and trucked across border (S)

block.p: The governors of four Mexican states bordering the United States are thinking about decriminalizing marijuana. The governor of Chihuahua, Patricio Martínez, said the idea arose because ''what has been done to date hasn't worked, because drug consumption keeps rising, in spite of the wars waged against it.'' Much of the marijuana sold in the United States is grown in Mexico and trucked across the border.
